name: Kindle
text: Kindle deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.

editions.flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.
Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.
Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.

name: Kindled Fury
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"It is most honorable to use every part of the animals we kill . . . especially if we use them to annihilate our enemies."
—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

"Rage is a dangerous weapon. Your enemies will try to use your anger against you. Use it against them first."
—Ajani Goldmane

"Rage is a dangerous weapon. Your enemies will try to use your anger against you. Use it against them first."
—Ajani Goldmane

"All beings carry the fire inside them. The challenge is to unleash it before they dwindle into oblivion."
—Illulia, flamekin soulstoke

name: Kindle the Carnage
text: Discard a card at random. If you do, Kindle the Carnage deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to each creature. You may repeat this process any number of times.

editions.flavor: "Start knockin' heads, boys, and don't stop 'til the ragamuffyn sings!"

name: Kindly Stranger
text: Delirium — {2}{B}: Transform Kindly Stranger. Activate this ability only if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: "I'm not afraid out here, for I know that a higher power protects me."

name: King Cheetah
text: Flash

editions.flavor:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a king cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a king cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend. —Suq'Ata wisdom

If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a King Cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom

name: King Crab
text: {1}{U}, {T}: Put target green creature on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor:
"I'm allergic to shellfish—not only did it kill my entire village, it also gave me this nasty rash."
—Olivia, fisher

name: Kingfisher
text:
Flying
When Kingfisher dies, draw a card.

editions.flavor: It's tastiest when served with the fish it stole.

name: King Macar, the Gold-Cursed
text: Inspired — Whenever King Macar, the Gold-Cursed becomes untapped, you may exile target creature. If you do, create a colorless artifact token named Gold. It has "Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

name: Kingpin's Pet
text:
Flying
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)

editions.flavor:
"Debt and death sound so similar, and thrulls are so hard of hearing. Mistakes are inevitable."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: King's Assassin
text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor: Fear is as effective a weapon as the blade.

name: King Suleiman
text: {T}: Destroy target Djinn or Efreet.

editions.flavor: "We made tempestuous winds obedient to Solomon . . . And many of the devils We also made obedient to him." —The Qur'an, 21:81

name: Kinsbaile Balloonist
text:
Flying
Whenever Kinsbaile Balloonist attacks, you may have target creature gain flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Even when a giant's tantrum turns the sky into a chaotic gale, the path of the balloonist never falters.

name: Kinsbaile Borderguard
text:
Kinsbaile Borderguard enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other Kithkin you control.
When Kinsbaile Borderguard dies, create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token for each counter on it.

name: Kinsbaile Cavalier
text: Knight creatures you control have double strike.

editions.flavor: Ambidexterity is common among kithkin. The thoughtweft links the minds of the left- and right-handed, giving each the knack of the other.
Ambidexterity is common among kithkin. The thoughtweft links the minds of the left- and right-handed, giving each the knack of the other.

name: Kinsbaile Skirmisher
text: When Kinsbaile Skirmisher enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "If a boggart even dares breathe near one of my kin, I'll know. And I'll not be happy."
"If a boggart even dares breathe near one of my kin, I'll know. And I'll not be happy."
"If a boggart even dares breathe near one of my kin, I'll know. And I'll not be happy."

name: Kinscaer Harpoonist
text:
Flying
Whenever Kinscaer Harpoonist attacks, you may have target creature lose flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The suspicious kithkin of Kinscaer patrol the skies, their eyes attuned to the shapes of outsiders.

name: Kin-Tree Invocation
text: Create an X/X black and green Spirit Warrior creature token, where X is the greatest toughness among creatures you control.

editions.flavor: The passing years add new rings to the tree's trunk, bolstering the spirits that dwell within.

name: Kin-Tree Warden
text:
{2}: Regenerate Kin-Tree Warden.
Morph {G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: "The amber of the tree and the blood of my veins are the same."

name: Kiora, Master of the Depths
text:
+1: Untap up to one target creature and up to one target land.
−2: Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a creature card and/or a land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
−8: You get an emblem with "Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have it fight target creature." Then create three 8/8 blue Octopus creature tokens.

name: Kiora's Dismissal
text:
Strive — Kiora's Dismissal costs {U} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Return any number of target enchantments to their owners' hands.

name: Kiora's Follower
text: {T}: Untap another target permanent.

editions.flavor: "She may call herself Kiora but I believe she is Thassa, the embodiment of the sea and empress of the depths."
"She may call herself Kiora but I believe she is Thassa, the embodiment of the sea and empress of the depths."

name: Kiora, the Crashing Wave
text:
+1: Until your next turn, prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target permanent an opponent controls.
−1: Draw a card. You may play an additional land this turn.
−5: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of your end step, create a 9/9 blue Kraken creature token."

name: Kira, Great Glass-Spinner
text:
Flying
Creatures you control have "Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability."

editions.flavor: Each spell is an intricate tapestry, and Kira is the great unraveler.
Each spell is an intricate tapestry, and Kira is the great unraveler.

name: Kird Ape
text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

editions.flavor: It puts the "fur" in "fury."
It puts the "fur" in "fury."
It puts the "fur" in "fury."
Apes can be gentle, contemplative beasts—but context is everything.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: Apes can be gentle, contemplative beasts—but context is everything.

name: Kird Chieftain
text:
Kird Chieftain gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Forest.
{4}{G}: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

name: Kiri-Onna
text:
When Kiri-Onna enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Kiri-Onna to its owner's hand.

name: Kirtar's Desire
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Threshold — Enchanted creature can't block as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Kirtar's Wrath
text:
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy all creatures, then create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

name: Kismet
text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

name: Kiss of Death
text: Kiss of Death deals 4 damage to target opponent. You gain 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"I'd sooner lock lips with a viper. At least I might walk away from that."
—Elvish scout

name: Kiss of the Amesha
text: Target player gains 7 life and draws two cards.

editions.flavor: Once a year, Akrasa holds a joust that draws knights and their leotaus from every nation on Bant. The prize is an Akrasan sigil, but the true reward is the angel's kiss.

name: Kitchen Finks
text:
When Kitchen Finks enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: Accept one favor from an ouphe, and you're doomed to accept another.
Accept one favor from an ouphe, and you're doomed to accept another.

name: Kitesail
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has flying.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor: Kitesailing is a way of life—and without practice, the end of it.
Kitesailing is a way of life—and without practice, the end of it.
Kitesailing is a way of life—and without practice, the end of it.
Kitesailing is a way of life—and without practice, the end of it.

name: Kitesail Apprentice
text: As long as Kitesail Apprentice is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.

editions.flavor: Carving lines through the sky, kite sailors map trails for the pilgrims below to follow.

name: Kitesail Scout
text: Flying

editions.flavor: "The wind in one's hair, the sun on one's back, the joy of open skies . . . the next generation of kor must know this kind of peace."

name: Kite Shield
text:
Equipped creature gets +0/+3.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor:
"To my sword I owe my glory, but to my shield I owe my life."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Kithkin Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.
Sacrifice Kithkin Armor: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to enchanted creature this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Kithkin Daggerdare
text: {G}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The kith dance their elaborate reels not merely to celebrate the events of their lives but to form an unbreakable bond of loyalty with their kin, a bond stronger than the fear of death itself.

name: Kithkin Greatheart
text: As long as you control a Giant, Kithkin Greatheart gets +1/+1 and has first strike.

editions.flavor: Sometimes a curious giant singles out a "little one" to follow for a few days, never realizing the effect it will have on the little one's life.
Sometimes a curious giant singles out a "little one" to follow for a few days, never realizing the effect it will have on the little one's life.

name: Kithkin Harbinger
text: When Kithkin Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Kithkin card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

editions.flavor: Her ears are open to even the softest voice.

name: Kithkin Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: The empathetic nature of the thoughtweft allows kithkin healers to treat the cause of an illness rather than fight its symptoms.

name: Kithkin Mourncaller
text: Whenever an attacking Kithkin or Elf is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: Eidren's hunts are dangerous affairs. All dread the inevitable recounting of those who died while flushing out his prey.

name: Kithkin Rabble
text:
Vigilance
Kithkin Rabble's power and toughness are each equal to the number of white permanents you control.

editions.flavor: If even the slightest hint of panic enters the thoughtweft, bakers, potters, and even medics drop their spoons and salves to take up arms.

name: Kithkin Shielddare
text: {W}, {T}: Target blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The nova glyph is a potent symbol. A shield embossed with it can resist the force of even the most determined giant.

name: Kithkin Spellduster
text:
Flying
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Kithkin Spellduster: Destroy target enchantment.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Kithkin Zealot
text: When Kithkin Zealot enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each black and/or red permanent target opponent controls.

editions.flavor: The more his flock fears, the more power he wields.

name: Kithkin Zephyrnaut
text: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Kithkin Zephyrnaut, you may reveal it. If you do, Kithkin Zephyrnaut gets +2/+2 and gains flying and vigilance until end of turn.

name: Kitsune Blademaster
text:
First strike
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: Those kitsune trained in the blade preferred to fight with a blade-catching jitte in the off hand, buying them just enough time to deliver the first deadly cut.

name: Kitsune Bonesetter
text: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Activate this ability only if you have more cards in hand than each opponent.

editions.flavor:
"He kept generations whole before the Kami War, and now he turns his century of wisdom to healing the latest casualties."
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Kitsune Dawnblade
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Kitsune Dawnblade enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.

name: Kitsune Diviner
text: {T}: Tap target Spirit.

editions.flavor: She who once led prayers honoring the kami adapted to use her influence to stay them.

name: Kitsune Healer
text:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
{T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target legendary creature this turn.

name: Kitsune Loreweaver
text: {1}{W}: Kitsune Loreweaver gets +0/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor: "Know your history. The lessons of the past will shield you in times of doubt."

name: Kitsune Mystic
text: At the beginning of the end step, if Kitsune Mystic is enchanted by two or more Auras, flip it.

name: Kitsune Palliator
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to each creature and each player this turn.

editions.flavor: "Who am I to judge who is deserving and who is not? That is a question for lords, not healers."

name: Kitsune Riftwalker
text: Protection from Spirits and from Arcane

editions.flavor: The wake of his passage shoved aside the influence of the kami.

name: Kiyomaro, First to Stand
text:
Kiyomaro, First to Stand's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
As long as you have four or more cards in hand, Kiyomaro has vigilance.
Whenever Kiyomaro deals damage, if you have seven or more cards in hand, you gain 7 life.

name: Kjeldoran Dead
text:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.

editions.flavor:
"They shall drink sorrow's dregs. They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Kjeldoran Elite Guard
text: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Kjeldoran Elite Guard. Activate this ability only during combat.

editions.flavor: The winged helms of the Guard are put on for pageants—but taken off for war.
The winged helms of the guard are put on for pageants—but taken off for war.
The winged helms of the Guard are put on for pageants—but taken off for war.

name: Kjeldoran Escort
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor:
"The first caravan has passed safely through the Karplusan Mountains without incident, forging a trade route to Balduvia. Kjeld himself would never have believed it"
—King Darien of Kjeldor

"We willingly trade with Kjeldor, but the peace we build must come from both our lands."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

name: Kjeldoran Frostbeast
text: At end of combat, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by Kjeldoran Frostbeast.

editions.flavor:
"Two of my Warriors found that the creature was dangerous not only in combat, but also in simple proximity."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"Two of my Warriors found that the creature was dangerous not only in combat, but also in simple proximity."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Kjeldoran Gargoyle
text:
Flying, first strike
Whenever Kjeldoran Gargoyle deals damage, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: The gargoyles were taken from the walls of flooded Kjeldoran cities and brought upland to guard the outposts of New Argive.

name: Kjeldoran Guard
text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Kjeldoran Guard. Activate this ability only during combat and only if defending player controls no snow lands.

name: Kjeldoran Home Guard
text: At end of combat, if Kjeldoran Home Guard attacked or blocked this combat, put a -0/-1 counter on Kjeldoran Home Guard and create a 0/1 white Deserter creature token.

name: Kjeldoran Javelineer
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Kjeldoran Javelineer deals damage equal to the number of age counters on it to target attacking or blocking creature.

name: Kjeldoran Knight
text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
{1}{W}: Kjeldoran Knight gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Kjeldoran Knight gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Those who do not ride the wind on Aesthir still command loyalty and respect."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Kjeldoran Outpost
text:
If Kjeldoran Outpost would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Plains instead. If you do, put Kjeldoran Outpost onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{1}{W}, {T}: Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.

name: Kjeldoran Outrider
text: {W}: Kjeldoran Outrider gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "I listen to people. He sniffs the wind. And we both sense something big coming. Something very big."

name: Kjeldoran Phalanx
text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor:
"There's nothing I like better than watching a street full of soldiers kicking down the doors of the guilty and the impure."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Kjeldoran Pride
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
{2}{U}: Attach Kjeldoran Pride to target creature other than enchanted creature.

name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.

editions.flavor:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

"Honorable in battle,
generous in death."
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard
Upon the frozen tundra stand the Kjeldoran Royal Guard, pikes raised, with the king's oath upon their lips.

name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
text: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor: The heartlink between soldier and steed is hatched with the aesthir struggling from its shell.

"If we do our duty and uphold our honor, Kjeldor shall stand for a thousand years."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

"If we do our duty and uphold our honor, Kjeldor shall stand for a thousand years."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Kjeldoran Skyknight
text: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor:
"My Aesthir is my most trusted ally. We fight as one and live as one, and we will die as one."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Kjeldoran War Cry
text: Creatures you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 1 plus the number of cards named Kjeldoran War Cry in all graveyards.

editions.flavor: King Darien's breath crystallized and fell to the frozen battlefield, but its command carried true to all soldiers of New Argive.

name: Kjeldoran Warrior
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor:
"Give me a thousand such Warriors and I could change the world."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Knacksaw Clique
text:
Flying
{1}{U}, {Q}: Target opponent exiles the top card of his or her library. Until end of turn, you may play that card. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: Most of the Knacksaw clique's skills were hewn from the minds of others.

name: Knight-Captain of Eos
text:
When Knight-Captain of Eos enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
{W}, Sacrifice a Soldier: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

editions.flavor: The strength of Bant's caste system is the unfailing loyalty of its meekest members.

". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33
Knights are quick to pledge their loyalty and even quicker to charge into battle.

". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

name: Knight Exemplar
text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Other Knight creatures you control get +1/+1 and have indestructible. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

editions.flavor: "If you think you are brave enough to walk the path of honor, follow me into the dragon's den."
"If you think you are brave enough to walk the path of honor, follow me into the dragon's den."

name: Knighthood
text: Creatures you control have first strike.

editions.flavor:
"He has returned. He who brought the dark ones. He who poisoned our paradise. How shall we greet him? With swift and certain death!"
—Radiant, archangel
Kings don't make knights. Actions do.

name: Knightly Valor
text:
Enchant creature
When Knightly Valor enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance.

text:

name: Knight of Dawn
text:
First strike
{W}{W}: Knight of Dawn gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
Flash like daybreak to the fray.
—Motto of the Knights of Dawn

name: Knight of Dusk
text: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.

editions.flavor:
Fall like night upon the foe.
—Motto of the Knights of Dusk
"Challenge me with your strongest. I will paint my sword with their blood."

name: Knight of Glory
text:
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: "I will uphold the law, and no manner of foe will stop me."

name: Knight of Infamy
text:
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: "Your laws, like your bones, were made to be broken."

name: Knight of Meadowgrain
text:
First strike
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: "By tradition, we don't speak for two days after battle. If our deeds won't speak for themselves, what else could be said?"
"By tradition, we don't speak for two days after battle. If our deeds won't speak for themselves, what else could be said?"

name: Knight of New Alara
text: Each other multicolored creature you control gets +1/+1 for each of its colors.

editions.flavor: "I embrace all of Alara, Grixis as much as Bant. Let my former home call me traitor. I do this not for accolades, but because it is right."
"I embrace all of Alara, Grixis as much as Bant. Let my former home call me traitor. I do this not for accolades, but because it is right."

name: Knight of Obligation
text:

name: Knight of Sursi
text:
Flying; flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Suspend 3—{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {W} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

name: Knight of the Hokey Pokey
text:
First strike

editions.flavor: That's what it's all about.

name: Knights of the Black Rose
text:
When Knights of the Black Rose enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
Whenever an opponent becomes the monarch, if you were the monarch as the turn began, that player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: "Hail to the true queen! Long may she reign!"
